timeline.bodyText: Might be able to get rid of the secondary storage account if it's not needed.
timeline.author: danieljurek
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,192 @@
+{
+    "$schema": "https://schema.management.azure.com/schemas/2019-04-01/deploymentTemplate.json#",
+    "contentVersion": "1.0.0.0",
+    "parameters": {
+        "baseName": {
+            "type": "String"
+        },
+        "endpointSuffix": {
+            "type": "string",
+            "defaultValue": "core.windows.net"
+        },
+        "testApplicationOid": {
+            "type": "string",
+            "metadata": {
+                "description": "The principal to assign the role to. This is application object id."
+            }
+        },
+        "formRecognizerBaseName": {
+            "type": "string",
+            "defaultValue": "[resourceGroup().name]",
+            "metadata": {
+                "description": "The base resource name."
+            }
+        },
+        "formRecognizerEndpointSuffix": {
+            "defaultValue": ".cognitiveservices.azure.com/",
+            "type": "String"
+        }
+    },
+    "variables": {
+        "storageApiVersion": "2019-04-01",
+        "authorizationApiVersion": "2018-09-01-preview",
+        "blobDataContributorRoleId": "[concat('/subscriptions/', subscription().subscriptionId, '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/ba92f5b4-2d11-453d-a403-e96b0029c9fe')]",
+        "contributorRoleId": "[concat('/subscriptions/', subscription().subscriptionId, '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/b24988ac-6180-42a0-ab88-20f7382dd24c')]",
+        "primaryAccountName": "[concat('prim', parameters('baseName'))]",
+        "secondaryAccountName": "[concat('sec', parameters('baseName'))]",
+        "location": "[resourceGroup().location]",
+        "formRecognizerApiVersion": "2017-04-18",
+        "azureFormRecognizerUrl": "[concat('https://', parameters('formRecognizerBaseName'), parameters('formRecognizerEndpointSuffix'))]",
+        "cognitiveServiceUserRoleId": "[concat('/subscriptions/', subscription().subscriptionId, '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/a97b65f3-24c7-4388-baec-2e87135dc908')]"
+    },
+    "resources": [
+        {
+            "type": "Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments",
+            "apiVersion": "[variables('authorizationApiVersion')]",
+            "name": "[guid(concat('dataContributorRoleId', variables('primaryAccountName')))]",
+            "dependsOn": [
+                "[variables('primaryAccountName')]"
+            ],
+            "properties": {
+                "roleDefinitionId": "[variables('blobDataContributorRoleId')]",
+                "principalId": "[parameters('testApplicationOid')]"
+            }
+        },
+        {
+            "type": "Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments",
+            "apiVersion": "[variables('authorizationApiVersion')]",
+            "name": "[guid(concat('contributorRoleId', variables('primaryAccountName')))]",
+            "dependsOn": [
+                "[variables('primaryAccountName')]"
+            ],
+            "properties": {
+                "roleDefinitionId": "[variables('contributorRoleId')]",
+                "principalId": "[parameters('testApplicationOid')]"
+            }
+        },
+        {
+            "type": "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts",
+            "apiVersion": "[variables('storageApiVersion')]",
+            "name": "[variables('primaryAccountName')]",
+            "location": "[variables('location')]",
+            "sku": {
+                "name": "Standard_RAGRS",
+                "tier": "Standard"
+            },
+            "kind": "StorageV2",
+            "properties": {
+                "networkAcls": {
+                    "bypass": "AzureServices",
+                    "virtualNetworkRules": [],
+                    "ipRules": [],
+                    "defaultAction": "Allow"
+                },
+                "supportsHttpsTrafficOnly": true,
+                "encryption": {
+                    "services": {
+                        "file": {
+                            "enabled": true
+                        },
+                        "blob": {
+                            "enabled": true
+                        }
+                    },
+                    "keySource": "Microsoft.Storage"
+                },
+                "accessTier": "Hot"
+            }
+        },
+        {
+            "type": "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts",

timeline.bodyText: formRecognizerBaseName is redundant, you can just use the baseName and and add any additional formatting in a variable.
timeline.author: danieljurek

timeline.bodyText: PRIMARY_STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME should be something like PRIMARY_STORAGE_ACCOUNT_URL or this hardcoded URL (https://%s.blob.core.windows.net) will affect testing in other clouds.
timeline.author: danieljurek

timeline.bodyText:
NIT:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - It uses the Form recognizer service `v2.0-preview.1` API.
          
          
            
            - It uses the Form Recognizer service `v2.0-preview.1` API.
timeline.author: mssfang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+# Release History
+
+## 1.0.0-beta.1 (Unreleased)
+Version 1.0.0-beta.1 is a preview of our efforts in creating a Azure Form Recognizer client library that is developer-friendly
+and idiomatic to the Java ecosystem. The principles that guide
+our efforts can be found in the [Azure SDK Design Guidelines for Java](https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_introduction.html).
+
+For more information about this, and preview releases of other Azure SDK libraries, please visit
+https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/releases/latest/java.html.
+
+- It uses the Form recognizer service `v2.0-preview.1` API.

Suggested change

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+# Release History
+
+## 1.0.0-beta.1 (Unreleased)
+Version 1.0.0-beta.1 is a preview of our efforts in creating a Azure Form Recognizer client library that is developer-friendly
+and idiomatic to the Java ecosystem. The principles that guide
+our efforts can be found in the [Azure SDK Design Guidelines for Java](https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_introduction.html).
+
+For more information about this, and preview releases of other Azure SDK libraries, please visit
+https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/releases/latest/java.html.
+
+- It uses the Form recognizer service `v2.0-preview.1` API.
+- Two client design:
+    - FormRecognizerClient to analyze fields/values on custom forms, receipts, and form content/layout

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                - FormTrainingClient to train custom models (with/without labels), and manage the custom models on your account
          
          
            
                - `FormTrainingClient` to train custom models (with/without labels), and manage the custom models on your account
timeline.author: mssfang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+# Release History
+
+## 1.0.0-beta.1 (Unreleased)
+Version 1.0.0-beta.1 is a preview of our efforts in creating a Azure Form Recognizer client library that is developer-friendly
+and idiomatic to the Java ecosystem. The principles that guide
+our efforts can be found in the [Azure SDK Design Guidelines for Java](https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_introduction.html).
+
+For more information about this, and preview releases of other Azure SDK libraries, please visit
+https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/releases/latest/java.html.
+
+- It uses the Form recognizer service `v2.0-preview.1` API.
+- Two client design:
+    - FormRecognizerClient to analyze fields/values on custom forms, receipts, and form content/layout
+    - FormTrainingClient to train custom models (with/without labels), and manage the custom models on your account

timeline.bodyText: these two seems valid model id and status model id?
timeline.author: mssfang

replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: create/use a static final variable for the model id.

replies.bodyText: It isn't reused anywhere else so didn't bother putting it in a static variable.
replies.author: samvaity
